alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 12:14PM MST until March 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Sedona affecting Coconino and Yavapai Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Oak Creek...including Sedona to Cornville...Minor to moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor to moderate flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Sedona. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Likely to cause minor flooding downstream in page springs area near gage OACA3 4 to 6 hours later. At 13.0 feet, Stream reaches terrace near Tlaquepaque bridge. Water reaches edge of several residential and commercial properties near Tlaquepaque bridge. Low water crossings closed. At 14.0 feet, Flood stage. Several islands downstream in sedona evacuated. Minor flooding of access roads, buildings, and residences along oak creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM MST Wednesday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.8 feet this evening. It will fall to 4.5 feet late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 02/15/2019. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Oak Creek Sedona 14.0 7.2 Wed 11 am MST 7.2 4.9 4.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued this evening.
